page.title: 04ST.JOHN'S CHURCH,WOLVERLEY
page.content: The village Church in Wolverley is dedicated to{St. John the Baptist}.It is situated on a hill overlooking the 'old' village of Wolverley. A priest is mentioned in the {Domesday Survey}. The{Church Register}of Births and Deaths dates from 1539 and is one of the oldest in the country. The present Church was built in the{Italian style}and opened in 1772. The bricks were said to have been made from clay dug during the construction of the nearby Staffordshire and Worcester Canal. Many alterations were made to the Church during the 19th. century. The present vicar is the {Rev.G.Shilvock.
